questiontext.text:
Given is the table of correlations for three predictors x1, x2 and x3:

——– ——– ——– ——– x1 x2 x3 x1 - x2 0.72 - x3 0.01 0.03 - ——– ——– ——– ——–

The regression equation for the dependent variable y with only x1 and x2 is \(\hat{y} = 8.75 + 3.51x_{1} + 4.32x_{2}\) Now suppose the model is calculated with x3 added. Then the coefficient

answer.text: Of x1 become much smaller and of x2 become much larger.

feedback.text: From x1 become much smaller and from x2 become much larger…: Incorrect

answer.text: From x1 remain about the same and from x2 also.

feedback.text: From x1 remain about the same and from x2 also…: Correct

answer.text: From x1 remain about the same and from x2 become much smaller.

feedback.text: From x1 remain about the same and for x2 become much smaller…: Incorrect
